text: Oh technology doesn't it sometimes feel
like anything is possible these days
well the folks at the Pew Research
Center wanted to find out what Americans
think about where tech will take us a
majority expect new tech will make the
future better and they're expecting
quite a bit need an organ grown in a lab
no not that kind of organ a human orbit
most Americans think that'll happen in
the next 50 years and watch out Picasso
half of Americans said computers will be
able to create art on par with humans
even with big expectations Americans
still think all this has limits need to
teleport something how about building
that vacation home on Mars or back on
Earth maybe control the weather nope
most don't think any of this will happen
even some conceivable technology raises
concerns about 6 and 10 people said they
weren't keen on altering the DNA of
future babies letting robots care for
Grandma or allowing drones to fly
through US airspace oh and about this
whole wearable tech craze going on right
now Pew Research found 53 percent of
Americans don't like the idea of wearing
devices that constantly show them info
about what's around them the survey also
found 3 themes around Americans talked
choices for future tech they'd like to
own there's travel improvements like
flying cars or personal spaceships
health improvements like living longer
and an oldie no pun intended but a
goodie time travel
David Botti BBC News Washington
